body_html:
The rendering works with the 'spreadsheet' attribute entirely removed.

Looking in a little more depth, we get an error when the spreadsheet is restricted to 312 lines. For example, if you remove lines 323:665 in the attached .dot file then no error is given. If you instead remove lines 324:665, i.e. 1 extra line, we get the error from before.

It does not seem like the syntax of lines 323 onwards is problematic, as we can move those CSS selectors earlier in the file and get no error, provided we don't go past 312 lines.

This looks like it is therefore a graphviz issue, but I will keep this open if we are interested in some kind of workaround for Tensorflow.

It does not seem like the syntax of lines 323 onwards is problematic, as we can move those CSS selectors earlier in the file and get no error, provided we don't go past 312 lines.
This looks like it is therefore a graphviz issue, but I will keep this open if we are interested in some kind of workaround for Tensorflow.
body:
The rendering works with the 'spreadsheet' attribute entirely removed. 

Looking in a little more depth, we get an error when the spreadsheet is restricted to 312 lines. For example, if you remove lines 323:665 in the attached `.dot` file then no error is given. If you instead remove lines 324:665, i.e. 1 extra line, we get the error from before.

It does not seem like the syntax of lines 323 onwards is problematic, as we can move those CSS selectors earlier in the file and get no error, provided we don't go past 312 lines. 

This looks like it is therefore a `graphviz` issue, but I will keep this open if we are interested in some kind of workaround for Tensorflow.
